data.source: COVID-19 case and death counts from the European Center for Disease Control; Government Efficiency Index from the World Bank; Cultural Tightness Index from Gelfand et al.
data.wave_or_subset: Nation-level cumulative data (528,019 confirmed cases) across 141 countries, converted to cases per million population.
data.access_details: Data and replication code reported as publicly available by the authors (specific links not stated in the summary).
data.notes: COVID-19 variables were log-transformed to capture exponential growth; outcome variables standardized to cases per million population.

method.description: The study regressed COVID-19 infection growth rates and mortality likelihood on cultural tightness, government efficiency, and their interaction, controlling for economic and demographic covariates. Both ordinary least squares and logistic regressions were used, supplemented by an evolutionary game-theory simulation to illustrate cooperative dynamics under ecological threat.
steps: Collect national‐level COVID-19 case and death counts from the ECDC.
Merge these with the World Bank Government Efficiency Index and the Gelfand et al. Cultural Tightness Index.
Calculate infections per million and log-transform outcome variables to capture exponential growth.
Control for GDP per capita, Gini inequality coefficients, median age, and population density.
Estimate OLS regressions for infection growth rates (Gaussian distribution).
Estimate logistic regressions for mortality likelihood (exponential distribution).
Test interaction effects between cultural tightness and government efficiency.
Conduct an evolutionary game-theory simulation on a 20×20 toroidal grid to model cooperation under varying threat levels and conformity rates.
Interpret model coefficients and translate effect sizes into differences in cases/deaths per million.
Provide data and code for replication.
method.models: Ordinary least squares regression; logistic regression; evolutionary game-theory simulation
method.outcome_variable: 1) Log-transformed COVID-19 cases per million (infection rate). 2) Mortality likelihood (percentage of deaths among confirmed cases).
method.independent_variables: Cultural Tightness Index; Government Efficiency Index; interaction term between tightness and efficiency.
method.control_variables: GDP per capita, Gini coefficient (inequality), median age, population density

results.summary: Both cultural tightness and government efficiency independently and interactively predicted slower growth in COVID-19 cases and lower mortality. Nations high in both tightness and efficiency experienced dramatically fewer infections and deaths compared to nations low on these dimensions.

numerical_results.outcome_name: Cases prevented in tight & efficient nations
numerical_results.unit: cases per million fewer per month

numerical_results.outcome_name: Mortality reduction in tight & efficient nations
